LanguageAndText

Class TextResourceBundle

  • java.lang.Object
    • LanguageAndText.TextResourceBundle

  • public class TextResourceBundle
extends java.lang.Object
    To deal in an efficient way with a property file objects of this method necessary actions and bundle the access to them in this class. For this a function for getting a property value (getString(String)) and testing (isLocalisationPossible(Locale)) and setting setLocalisation(Locale)) a new localisation is provided. For logging like MissingResourceException the ILoggerFactory is used.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    9045534
    See Also:
    TextFacade, ResourceBundle

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextResourceBundle

        public TextResourceBundle(java.lang.String baseName,
                          java.util.Locale localisation,
                          java.lang.ClassLoader loader)
        Public constructor setting up and loading the property file.
        Parameters:
        baseName - Base name of the property file
        localisation - Localisation which should be loaded for the property file
        loader - Loader for the property file (see ResourceBundle.getBundle(String, Locale, ClassLoader)

    • Method Detail

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Returns the value of the property given by propertyName. If no property file is loaded or the property name not exists in this file the empty string "" is returned.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - Property for which the value should be returned
        Returns:
        Value of property in file. By default or exception "" is returned.

      • isLocalisationPossible

        public boolean isLocalisationPossible(java.util.Locale localisation)
        Tests if the given localisation of the property file is existing.
        Parameters:
        localisation - Localisation to test
        Returns:
        If the property file could be loaded successfully this return value is true. Otherwise false is returned and the exception is logged in an ILogger.
        See Also:
        setLocalisation(Locale), ILogger

      • setLocalisation

        public boolean setLocalisation(java.util.Locale localisation)
        Sets the localisation of the property file to given Locale object.
        Parameters:
        localisation - New localisation set to
        Returns:
        If the property file could be loaded successfully this return value is true. Otherwise false is returned and the exception is logged in an ILogger. Don´t use this method for just testing because the last property file might be not readable anymore. So in this purpose use isLocalisationPossible(Locale) instead.
        See Also:
        isLocalisationPossible(Locale), ILogger
